Posts.Content: On 6/10/2009 Arlene C. wrote: How do I get to the message board discussing osteonecrosis of the jaw bone resulting from having biphospinate treatments, such as Zometa?  I'm new to message boards.  I was reading a message board pertaining to jaw bone problems and got lost because I had to enroll and got all turned around.  I want to share my experience with those who posted there.  TY I have had osteonecrosis of the jaw bone.  It hurt and I lost 2 teeth from it.  After everything healed I was fine, just missing some teeth.  I was also told by my oncologist NOT to have ANY work done on the jaw area affected.   I don't remember why.  Sorry.  While I was dealing with it I was on a liquid diet.  I also ate Malt-O-Meal.  Other than this, I don't remember much.  Now I can eat whatever I want as long as it isn't too difficult to chew. Good Luck to you! Rosalynne
Posts.Title: ONJ

Posts.Content: On 6/9/2009 jay horses wrote: my friend a 60 y old 3 yr survivor got mets to bone in march and now liver and lungs, does anyone have a similar problem and  how is it going? thx Yes, I also have mets to bones, liver and lungs.  I have had mets for the past 7 years and my quality of life is wonderful!  I need to nap several days a week but my children are old enough to care for themselves (15 & 20).  I often go out with them or my husband and we are currently getting ready to spend a week in a cabin in the woods.  I am currently on chemo on a weekly basis but this chemo has so few side effects I would never know by how I feel. Tell your friend to take a deep breath and not to worry (too much).  Living with stage IV cancer is very doable.  I have been doing it for the past 7 years with occasional trips to the hospital. Good Luck to her and to you as her friend. Rosalynne
Posts.Title: mets to bone and now liver and lungs
